summary.long: Haggai is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: In the second year of King Darius, in the sixth month, on the first day, the word of Yahweh came through Haggai the prophet to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says Yahweh of hosts: ‘This people says, “The time has not come to rebuild the temple of Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of Yahweh came through Haggai the prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is it a time for you yourselves to dwell in your houses that have been paneled while this house is desolate?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so then, thus says Yahweh of hosts: ‘Consider your ways!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have sown much but have harvested little. You have eaten without being satisfied; you have drunk without being satiated; you have worn clothes without being warm; the one who earns wages puts it in a pouch with holes.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says Yahweh of hosts: ‘Consider your ways!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go up the mountain and bring wood and build the house so that I may be pleased with it and honored,’ says Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You have looked for much, and look! It came to little; and when you brought it home, I blew it away. Why?’ declares Yahweh of hosts. ‘Because my house is desolate and you are running each to your own house!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, because of you the heavens have withheld the dew and the earth has withheld its produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have called for a drought on the land and the hills, on the grain, the new wine, the olive oil, on what the soil produces, on human beings and wild animals, and on all their labor.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, Joshua son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and all the remnant of the people gave heed to the voice of Yahweh their God and to the words of Haggai the prophet, as Yahweh their God had sent him, and the people feared Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Haggai the messenger of Yahweh spoke to the people with the message of Yahweh, saying, “‘I am with you’ declares Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh stirred up the spirit of Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and the spirit of Joshua son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and the spirit of all the remnant of the people. And they came and did the work on the house of Yahweh of hosts, their God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on the twenty-fourth day of the sixth month in the second year of King Darius.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the seventh month on the twenty-first day, the word of Yahweh came through Haggai the prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak now to Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and to the remnant of the people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Who among you is left that saw this house in its former glory? And how do you see it now? Does it seem like nothing to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But now take courage, Zerubbabel,’ declares Yahweh. ‘Take courage, Joshua son of Jehozadak, the high priest, and take courage, all the people of the land,’ declares Yahweh. ‘Do the work, because I am with you,’ declares Yahweh of hosts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘according to the promise that I covenanted with you when you came out of Egypt. My spirit is with you; do not be afraid.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says Yahweh of hosts: ‘Once again, in a little while, I will shake the heavens and the earth and the sea and dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will shake all the nations so that the treasure of all the nations will come, and I will fill this house with glory,’ says Yahweh of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The silver is mine and the gold is mine,’ declares Yahweh of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The latter glory of this house will be greater than the former,’ says Yahweh of hosts, ‘and in this place I will give peace’ declares Yahweh of hosts.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of Yahweh came to the prophet Haggai, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says Yahweh of hosts: ‘Ask now the priests for a ruling:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man carries consecrated meat in the hem of his garment, and his hem touches bread, or stew, or wine, or olive oil, or any kind of food, will it become holy?’” The priests answered, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Haggai said, “If one who is unclean from contact with a corpse touches any of these, will it become unclean?” The priests answered, “Yes, it will be become unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Haggai answered and said, “‘So it is with this people, and with this nation before me,’ declares Yahweh, ‘and so it is with every kind of work of their hands; and what they offer there is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, please consider from this day forward, before one stone was placed on another in the temple of Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from that time when one came to a heap of twenty measures, there were only ten, and when one came to the wine vat to draw out fifty measures, there were only twenty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I struck you with blight, and with plant mildew, and hail, all the work of your hands. But you did not come back to me,’ declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Please consider from this day forward, from the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, from the day that the foundation of Yahweh’s temple was laid, consider:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is there still seed in the store chamber? Do the vine, the fig tree, the pomegranate, and the olive tree still produce nothing? From this day forward I will bless you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of Yahweh came to Haggai a second time on the twenty-fourth day of the month saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah: I am going to shake the heavens and the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will overthrow the thrones of kingdoms and destroy the military strength of the kingdoms of the nations. I will overthrow chariots and their drivers; horses and their riders will fall, every one by the sword of another!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘On that day,’ declares Yahweh of hosts, ‘I will take you, Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, my servant,’ declares Yahweh, ‘and I will make you a signet ring, for I have chosen you,’ declares Yahweh of hosts.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
